mcq.question: Which AWS service is used to create isolated virtual networks?
Which Azure service allows you to create private networks in the cloud?
Which service connects on-premises networks to cloud networks securely?
Which AWS service provides domain name system management?
Which Azure service routes traffic across regions for high availability?
Which component controls inbound and outbound traffic in AWS VPC?
Which AWS service provides scalable content delivery globally?
Which Azure service allows secure cross-premises connectivity?
Which networking feature enables traffic isolation between subnets in cloud?
Which cloud concept ensures high availability and failover for services?

tf.question: AWS VPC allows creation of isolated virtual networks.
Azure Virtual Network (VNet) is used for private networking in Azure.
VPN Gateway enables secure connectivity between on-premises and cloud networks.
AWS Route 53 is used for domain name resolution and DNS management.
Azure Traffic Manager distributes traffic across regions for high availability.
Security Groups and NACLs control inbound and outbound traffic in AWS VPC.
CloudFront is used for global content delivery and caching.
Subnetting with NACLs cannot isolate traffic between cloud subnets.
Azure VPN Gateway provides secure cross-premises connectivity.
Multi-AZ deployment ensures redundancy and high availability.
